parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant

parameters.description: Avi Tenant Header UUID
parameters.name: X-Avi-Tenant-UUID

parameters.description: The caller is required to set Avi Version Header to the expected version of configuration. The response from the controller will provide and accept data according to the specified version. The controller will reject POST and PUT requests where the data is not compatible with the specified version.
parameters.name: X-Avi-Version

parameters.description: Avi Controller may send back CSRF token in the response cookies. The caller should update the request headers with this token else controller will reject requests.
parameters.name: X-CSRFToken

parameters.description: WafCRS object creation
parameters.name: body

parameters.description: object name
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that refers to another Avi resource. Its syntax is refers_to=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all virtual services referring to pool p1 will be refers_to=pool:pool_p1_uuid
parameters.name: refers_to

parameters.description: Filter to request all objects that are referred by another Avi resource. Its syntax is referred_by=<obj_type>:<obj_uuid>. Eg. get all pools referred_by virtual service vs1 - referred_by=virtualservice:vs_vs1_uuid
parameters.name: referred_by

parameters.description: List of fields to be returned for the resource. Some fields like name, URL, uuid etc. are always returned.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: All the Avi REST reference URIs have a name suffix as URI#name. It is useful to get the referenced resource name without performing get on that object.
parameters.name: include_name

parameters.description: Default values are not set.
parameters.name: skip_default

parameters.description: It automatically returns additional dependent resources like runtime. Eg. join_subresources=runtime.
parameters.name: join_subresources

ip_addr.description: Placeholder for description of property ip_addr of obj type IpAddrPrefix field type str  type object

exclude_list.description: Exclude list for the WAF rule group. The fields in the exclude list entry are logically and'ed to deduce the exclusion criteria. If there are multiple excludelist entries, it will be 'logical or' of them. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

enable.description: Enable or disable WAF Rule Group. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

rules.description: Rules as per Modsec language. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

force_detection.description: When set to 'true', any rule in this group will not cause 'deny' or 'redirect' actions to run, even if WAF Policy is set to enforcement mode. The behavior would be as if this rule operated in detection mode regardless of WAF Policy setting. Field deprecated in 18.1.5. Field introduced in 18.1.4.

_last_modified.description: UNIX time since epoch in microseconds. Units(MICROSECONDS).

name.description: The name of this ruleset object. Field introduced in 18.2.1.

release_date.description: The release date of this version in RFC 3339 / ISO 8601 format. Field introduced in 18.1.1.

tenant_ref.description: Tenant that this object belongs to. It is a reference to an object of type Tenant. Field introduced in 18.2.1.

version.description: The version of this ruleset object. Field introduced in 18.1.1.

groups.description: WAF Rules are sorted in groups based on their characterization. Field introduced in 18.1.1.

integrity.description: Integrity protection value. Field introduced in 18.2.1.

description.description: A short description of this ruleset. Field introduced in 18.1.1.

uri_path.description: URI Path to exclude for WAF rules. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

description.description: Free-text comment about this exclusion. Field introduced in 18.2.6.

uri_match_criteria.description: Criteria for URI matching. Field introduced in 17.2.8.

match_element_criteria.description: Criteria for match_element matching. Field introduced in 18.2.2.

client_subnet.description: Client IP Subnet to exclude for WAF rules. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

match_element.description: The match_element can be 'ARGS xxx', 'ARGS_GET xxx', 'ARGS_POST xxx', 'ARGS_NAMES xxx', 'FILES xxx', 'QUERY_STRING', 'REQUEST_BASENAME', 'REQUEST_BODY', 'REQUEST_URI', 'REQUEST_URI_RAW', 'REQUEST_COOKIES xxx', 'REQUEST_HEADERS xxx' or 'RESPONSE_HEADERS xxx'. These match_elements in the HTTP Transaction (if present) will be excluded when executing WAF Rules. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

match_case.description: Case sensitivity to use for the matching. Enum options - SENSITIVE, INSENSITIVE. Field introduced in 17.2.8.

match_op.description: String Operation to use for matching the Exclusion. Enum options - BEGINS_WITH, DOES_NOT_BEGIN_WITH, CONTAINS, DOES_NOT_CONTAIN, ENDS_WITH, DOES_NOT_END_WITH, EQUALS, DOES_NOT_EQUAL, REGEX_MATCH, REGEX_DOES_NOT_MATCH. Field introduced in 17.2.8.

exclude_list.description: Exclude list for the WAF rule. The fields in the exclude list entry are logically and'ed to deduce the exclusion criteria. If there are multiple excludelist entries, it will be 'logical or' of them. Field introduced in 17.2.3.

enable.description: Enable or disable WAF Rule Group. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

name.description: User-friendly optional name for a rule. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

tags.description: Tags for WAF rule as per Modsec language. They are extracted from the tag action in a ModSec rule. Field introduced in 18.1.3.

rule.description: Rule as per Modsec language. Field introduced in 17.2.1.

mode.description: WAF Rule mode. This can be detection or enforcement. If this is not set, the Policy mode is used. This only takes effect if the policy allows delegation. Enum options - WAF_MODE_DETECTION_ONLY, WAF_MODE_ENFORCEMENT. Field introduced in 18.1.5, 18.2.1.

force_detection.description: When set to 'true', this rule will not cause 'deny' or 'redirect' actions to run, even if WAF Policy is set to enforcement mode. The behavior would be as if this rule operated in detection mode regardless of WAF Policy setting. Field deprecated in 18.1.5. Field introduced in 18.1.4.

rule_id.description: Identifier (id) for a rule per Modsec language. All SecRule and SecAction directives require an id. It is extracted from the id action in a ModSec rule. Rules within a single WAF Policy are required to have unique rule_ids. Field introduced in 17.2.2.
